title.native: 文豪ストレイドッグス 第2シーズン

description:
The second season of Bungou Stray Dogs.

Despite their differences in position, three men—the youngest senior executive of the Port Mafia, Osamu Dazai, the lowest ranking member, Sakunosuke Oda, and the intelligence agent, Angou Sakaguchi—gather at the Lupin Bar at the end of the day to relax and take delight in the company of friends.

However, one night, Angou disappears. A photograph taken at the bar is all that is left of the three together.

Fast forward to the present, and Dazai is now a member of the Armed Detective Agency. The Guild, an American gifted organization, has entered the fray and is intent on taking the Agency's work permit. They must now divide their attention between the two groups, the Guild and the Port Mafia, who oppose their very existence.
synonyms: คณะประพันธกรจรจัด ภาค 2

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kafkaasagiri) | [Profile](https://twpf.jp/kafkaasagiri)

A Japanese mangaka and novelist. He also sometimes does screenwriting for anime.

__[Blog](http://3c5u3r5r3y5.blog97.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/3c5u3r5r3y5)__

**Harukawa35** is a Japanese mangaka and illustrator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/igarashi_takuya)

Formerly part of [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Currently freelance with ties to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

**Birthplace:** Shiga Prefecture, Japan
**Graduated:** Kyoto College of Arts (now known as Kyoto University of Art and Design)

**Youji Enokido** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer. He has been friends with director [Ikuhara Kunihiko](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara) since high school.

**[Profile (Office Without)](http://www.officewithout.com/iwasaki.html)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/taque68)** | **[MySpace](https://myspace.com/taqueiwasaki)** | **[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/soundtrack-maker)**

A composer and musician generally known for his jazz-like scores.

When he was 3 years old he was given a piano, he was also taken to Yamaha Music School, where he first came into contact with music. He quit music school as an elementary school student and, until his high school years, studied under Iwashita Tetsuya, who taught him how to use multiple recordings and synthesizers. He became a composer in his later high school years, through the various efforts made by himself and his teacher.

In 1985, he won a prize at the Kanagawa Arts Festival choral composition competition, while in the late 1980s, after entering Tokyo University of the Arts, he studied contemporary music under Satou Shin and Aoshima Hiroshi. While still being a student, he received the New Artist Award from the Japan Contemporary Music Association. He later started working as an arranger after graduating from college.

In 1999, he participated in the music unit "Smart Drug" with Koizumi Hiroshi, who was responsible for doing the composition and playing the guitar, and Okamoto Sayori who would later rename to Hiyoko, who was responsible for doing the lyrics and vocals. He participated under the alias "Taque," where he was responsible for the arrangement and playing the keyboard. They released three CDs from 1999 to 2002.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.

Website | Twitter | Facebook | YouTube Introduction Luck Life is a band which began its activities formally in 2008. It was originally formed in 2005, as its members were classmates at Ibaraki East High School in Osaka Prefecture. Their major debut was with the Bungou Stray Dogs ending theme "Namae wo Yobu yo" in 2016. Members - [PON](https://anilist.co/staff/149059/Masumi-Ueno) (Masumi Ueno) - vocal, guitar - Ikoma (Takahide Ikoma) - guitar, chorus - Taku (Takuya Kubo) - bass - LOVE Ooishi (Yutaka Ooishi) - drums

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/南雅彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masahiko_Minami)

A founder and representative director of studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/). Also the leading producer of its Studio B.

After graduating from Osaka University of Arts, Minami joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) in 1984. There he did desk work and served as a production assistant on many of [Masuo Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/148840/)'s productions. He was promoted to producer on [Musha Knight Commando](https://anilist.co/anime/9087/) in 1991, and from there he went on to produce shows such as [Mobile Fighter G Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/96/), [Vision of Escaflowne](https://anilist.co/anime/182/) and [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). In 1998, he left Sunrise and established Bones with [Toshihiro Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/103531/) and the late [Hiroshi Ousaka](https://anilist.co/staff/107410/). He was elected as the representative director of the studio and has held the position since.

Minami's classmates at university included [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/), [Hiroyuki Yamaga](https://anilist.co/staff/100988/), and [Kazuhiko Shimamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/97479/). He appears as a character in the manga [Aoi Honoo](https://anilist.co/manga/55292/), which Shimamoto wrote about his own university days. The manga also received a TV drama adaptation, in which Minami was portrayed by actor Kaname Endou.

(Source: Wikipedia)
__Kunihiro Takeda__ is a Japanese director, animation planner and the representative director of Sony PCL.
